body_html: @ezyang it is probably going to be quite difficult, because glog and gflags are both binary-wide libraries (global variables etc) - I tried in the past and did not have much success. In principle, if one is using python, probably no-glog-no-gflags version is going to be fine.
body_text: @ezyang it is probably going to be quite difficult, because glog and gflags are both binary-wide libraries (global variables etc) - I tried in the past and did not have much success. In principle, if one is using python, probably no-glog-no-gflags version is going to be fine.
body: @ezyang it is probably going to be quite difficult, because glog and gflags are both binary-wide libraries (global variables etc) - I tried in the past and did not have much success. In principle, if one is using python, probably no-glog-no-gflags version is going to be fine.
